noun.description: An expert in or student of etymology; = "etymologist".

origin: Early 17th century; earliest use found in Edmund Bolton (?1575/5–?1634), antiquary and historian. From classical Latin etymologus (Varro; probably from Byzantine Greek ἐτυμολόγος (first attested later than the Latin word; from Hellenistic Greek ἔτυμον + -λογος: see -loger)) + -er.
